interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2021/12/28
Average Rating: 3.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Stephen Durham'], 'Producers': ['Stephen Durham', 'Hemdee Kiwanuka'], 'Starring': ['Ellen Hollman', 'Matt Passmore', 'Geraldine Singer'], 'Studio': ["Uncork'd Entertainment"]}
Review Text: All you need to know is that the lead actress (very fine by the way) kills a bad guy from 10 feet away while he is fully auto shooting at her and another women.  She spins around and  jumps and does a body roll and throws a knife and seemed to hit the guy in the belly while he is fully auto on an M4 rifle.  I stopped the movie right there.
Review Title: An embarassment to action movies
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Keanu Comedy, Action, Intense, Fun ['Cousins hatch a plot to retrieve a stolen cat by posing as drug dealers for a street gang.'] {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Peter Atencio'], 'Producers': ['Keegan-Michael Key', 'Jordan Peele', 'Peter Principato', 'Paul Young', 'Joel Zadak'], 'Starring': ['Jordan Peele', 'Keegan-Michael Key', 'Tiffany Haddish']} it had a few funny scenes but I could only suffer through 30-40mins till I got bored and started washing clothes instead. I like the main actors. I would like to see them in a better movie. Kinda funny but lost interest less than half way through.... {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['J Blakeson'], 'Producers': ['Tobey Maguire'], 'Starring': ['Chloë Grace Moretz', 'Nick Robinson', 'Ron Livingston'], 'Studio': ['Columbia Pictures']} Just terrible....and cheesy. Don't waste your time. Watch Cspan or an infomercial instead. {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['J.J. Abrams'], 'Producers': ['Kathleen Kennedy', 'J.J. Abrams', 'Bryan Burk'], 'Starring': ['Harrison Ford', 'Mark Hamill', 'Carrie Fisher'], 'Studio': ['Lucasfilm']} Great. I want the force so I can fetch drinks and food while I rewatch. Awesome nice franchise for episode 7. {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Schenkman'], 'Producers': ['Richard Schenkman', 'Eric D. Wilkinso'], 'Starring': ['David Lee Smith', 'Sterling Knight', 'Michael Dorn'], 'Studio': ['WowNow Entertainment']} This was a VERY disappointing sequel to the original which was an awesome plot/story that was riveting.

Don't ruin your memory from the original and pretend this turd doesn't exist. I agree with most of everybody else Shazam! Fantasy, Comedy, Exciting, Sweet ['Billy Batson is a streetwise 14-year-old who can magically transform into the adult superhero Shazam simply by shouting out one word. His newfound powers soon get put to the test when he squares off against the evil Dr. Thaddeus Sivana.'] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Sandberg'], 'Producers': ['Peter Safran'], 'Starring': ['Zachary Levi', 'Asher Angel', 'Mark Strong']} I'm not going to write a long explanation.

It's a good story, likable characters, lots of humor with a splash of seriousness and a decent bad guy. They improved the series dialogue.

The general CGI was good for an Amazon production. I really liked the movie sets and clothing. It seems to have an Irish feel. Good Fantasy story {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dexter Fletcher'], 'Producers': ['Matthew Vaughn', 'David Furnish', 'Adam Bohling', 'David Reid', 'Elton John', 'Claudia Vaughn', 'Brian Oliver', 'Steve Hamilton Shaw', 'Michael Gracey'], 'Starring': ['Taron Egerton', 'Jamie Bell', 'Richard Madden']} First off, I have a lot of downloaded Elton John music. Having said that, this movie was a terrible musical. I want my money back. I hated it from the very opening scene. I struggled and fast forwarded over half way through and still the same.

I want my $5 back. Great Musician.....Terrible musical.....I hated it {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Neil Marshall'], 'Producers': ['Lawrence Gordon', 'Lloyd Levin', 'Mike Richardson', 'Philip Westgren', 'Carl Hampe', 'Matt O’toole', 'Les Weldon'], 'Starring': ['David Harbour', 'Milla Jovovich', 'Ian McShane'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']} This movie is very close to the original Hell boy with Ron Perlman. They didn't change a whole lot from the orginal movie. It has better CGI and the actor is a little darker but I'm so glad I rented with a Prime discount of $2.99.

I wouldn't recommend this movie to a friend but I might to an enemy to get them to waste money. Blah movie {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', 'Українська', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Sam Esmail', 'Kyle Patrick Alvarez'], 'Producers': ['Sam Esmail', 'Matt Lieber', 'Micah Bloomberg', 'Alex Blumberg', 'Chris Giliberti', 'Marisa Yeres Gill', 'Lisa Roberts Gillan', 'Chad Hamilton', 'Eli Horowitz'], 'Starring': ['Julia Roberts', 'Bobby Cannavale', 'Stephan James']} I Just started watching this series mainly due to the fact that I'm obsessed with Julia Robert's lips. This series is slow moving but has great acting/actors/actresses and an original plot. I also enjoyed because it was 10 episodes of 30 minutes so I wasn't clock invested as much. I read that Julia is not reprising her role but remaining a producer. If this is true, I won't watch the next season. I hate when they replace actors in lead roles. Enjoyable and original plot {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'हिन्दी', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Türkçe', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', 'Українська', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Amy Sherman-Palladino', 'Daniel Palladino', 'Dan Attias'], 'Producers': ['Amy Sherman-Palladino', 'Daniel Palladino', 'Dhana Gilbert', 'Daniel Goldfarb', 'Kate Fodor', 'Sono Patel'], 'Starring': ['Rachel Brosnahan', 'Alex Borstein', 'Michael Zegen']} Just as good as the first two seasons but different. Season 1 focused on the life of a comic. Season 2 delves into Jewish american lifestyles. Season 3 is about show business and how back stabbing it is with focus on family dynamics and turmoil.

These One-star reviewers seem to think this is a documentary of the 60s. ITS A COMEDY-DRAMA SERIES not a Ken Burn's special. A lot of bozo reviewers on here think they are Roger Ebert or Gene Siskel or something. OMG. its a great show. profile:
**User Summary Update:**

- **Genre Preference:** The user maintains a strong inclination towards comedy interwoven with fantasy, emphasizing a growing demand for original narratives and quality storytelling that enhances adaptation consistency.

- **Engagement Level:** The user exhibits a robust interest in complete series, favoring concise episodes that allow for quick engagement, reflecting their preference for easily consumable narratives.

- **Actor Appreciation:** Recent interactions indicate an intensified sensitivity to casting changes, as the user is increasingly valuing consistent casting in their series selections. The disappointment over poor execution in a recent viewing highlights their investment in actor quality.

- **Review Disposition:** The user’s discerning perspective is evident through a critical review detailing frustration with inadequate action sequences, reinforcing their expectations for quality performances. They show readiness to disengage from series that fail to maintain casting consistency.

- **Tolerance for Content:** Their evolving standards favor depth and originality, indicating a shift towards critical engagement with narratives, especially those failing to showcase strong performances.

- **Overall Trend:** The user is increasingly focused on engaging content that preserves continuity in both casting and storytelling quality. Recent critiques underscore their commitment to narrative integrity, balancing an appreciation for acting talent and authentic storytelling, while expressing frustration over subpar presentations in genres outside their usual preferences.
